intro: Lonchocarpus rugosus subsp. rugosus, commonly known as the rough legume, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its compound leaves and produces distinctive, woody pods that contain seeds. The plant belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes many legumes known for nitrogen-fixing abilities. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks. Its ornamental value and potential ecological roles make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
